duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop and execute personalized fitness programs to help members achieve their specific fitness goals.
Engage with members through one-on-one personal training, small group training, and member engagement activities.
Maintain client programs and fitness assessment forms, ensuring accurate records and documentation.
Adhere to club policies and procedures, ensuring the safety and satisfaction of club members.
Participate in fitness education and outreach activities to promote fitness and health within the community.
Handle administrative tasks, including scheduling, session authorization, and maintaining client records.
Collaborate with the Fitness Leaders and Operations/Sales team to evaluate member needs and provide fitness services.
Meet and exceed session, revenue, and sales targets to drive business growth and member retention.
Maintain active CPR/AED certification and continuously seek professional development opportunities.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree helpful, but not required in Exercise Physiology, Kinesiology, Recreation or P.E. related field.
Active Child & Adult AED/CPR certification required.
Certified Personal Trainer (CPT) from approved list of personal training certifications at NYSC.
